Title.evidence: A Randomised Controlled Trial Comparing Mini-Subvastus and Standard Medial Parapatellar Approaches in Total Knee Arthroplasty

Trial_Design.evidence: The unit of randomisation was the individual patient.

Intervention.evidence: randomised to either a mini-subvastus approach or a standard medial parapatellar approach

Method_Outcome.evidence: Participants were evaluated preoperatively and 2 months postoperatively.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was computer-generated, and allocation was concealed.

Result_Outcome.evidence: Both groups showed improvements in functional scores, QOL, and gait parameters.
